楚.definition: distinct; clear; orderly; pain; suffering; deciduous bush used in Chinese medicine (genus Vitex); punishment cane (old)

楚國.definition: the state of Chu, one of the most important of the small states contending for power in China between 770 and 223 BC, located around present-day Hubei

楚懷王.definition: King Huai of Chu (reigned 328-299 BC); later King Huai of Chu (reigned 208-205 BC)

楚河漢界.definition: lit. the river that divides Chu and Han; fig. a line that divides rival territories; the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard

楚漢戰爭.definition: Chu-Han Contention (206-202 BC), power struggle between Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] of Han and Xiang Yu 項羽|项羽[Xiang4 Yu3] of Chu

楚漢相爭.definition: see 楚漢戰爭|楚汉战争[Chu3 Han4 Zhan4 zheng1]

楚莊王.definition: King Zhuang of Chu (reigned 613-591 BC), one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸

楚辭.definition: Songs of Chu, an anthology of poetic songs, many from the state of Chu 楚[Chu3], collected in the Han dynasty 漢朝|汉朝[Han4chao2]

楚雄.definition: see 楚雄彝族自治州[Chu3xiong2 Yi2zu2 Zi4zhi4zhou1]; see 楚雄市[Chu3xiong2 Shi4]

楚雄州.definition: see 楚雄彝族自治州[Chu3xiong2 Yi2zu2 Zi4zhi4zhou1]

楚雄市.definition: Chuxiong, county-level city, capital of Chuxiong Yi Autonomous Prefecture 楚雄彝族自治州[Chu3xiong2 Yi2zu2 Zi4zhi4zhou1] in central Yunnan

楚雄彝族自治州.pinyin: Chu3 xiong2 Yi2 zu2 Zi4 zhi4 zhou1
楚雄彝族自治州.definition: Chuxiong Yi Autonomous Prefecture, in Yunnan Province 雲南省|云南省[Yun2nan2 Sheng3]
